used to refer to a search for oil in a new area without knowing if any will be found, or if a profit can be made from it: Wildcat drilling is a big risk but investors stand to make huge profits if oil is found.
a supply of oil discovered in a new area: The energy giant is experiencing difficulties with its wildcats off the Venezuelan coast. wildcatter noun [ C ]
Wildcatters are scouring Africa and the US deserts in search of oil. wildcat verb [ I ]
